heisig_chinese_memo: Horse is turkey with the drops at the top removed and tail feathers added.
heisig_story: Let the extra vertical stroke in the mane combine with the first vertical stroke to give an image of the horse's long neck. The only odd thing is the tail feathers at the end, but that should present a good image to remember the character by. The fact that the last stroke of mane and the first of tail feathers coincide should no longer surprise you.
koohiiStory1: Turkey with the drops at the top removed and tail feathers added (this matches stroke order and there are the tail feathers already, why not have the whole bird). If you take the two drops of Èöπ as wings, then horses are like turkeys, but have no wings and have more prominent tail "feathers". Both are actually supposed to be pictographs, though.
koohiiStory2: The top part is half a comb (see frame 1920) with an extra vertical stroke to account for a sturdier version used to comb a horse mane. As a primitive I used the theme of the Trojan Horse. Not the modern computer viruses, but the large wooden horse which led to the demise of Troy and of the Trojans. Either its size (much greater than a live horse), or the fact that it conceals things into its belly, will set it appart from the horse primitive that came in frame 568 ("noon").

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The horse radical and the horse kanji are exactly the same! Huzzah!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You are looking at a horse. It's looking at you. You try making horse noises at it, to get a reaction. Instead of reacting with a normal horse noise, it just makes sheep noises: "Baaa," („Å∞) it says. "Baaaaa."
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Feel the shock of this. It sounds just like a sheep, it's strange.

origin_of_ch_char_book: (È¶¨, È©¨, ma, horse) describes a horse with big head and shows the horse‚Äôs mane.
humanum_full_description_en:
The shape of an oracle bone like " horse " is characterized by the mane on the neck of the horse. The early Bronze clan emblems were very pictographic. Later, the glyphs gradually changed into strokes, but the glyphs still often marked the mane of " horse ". In the Warring States period, the torso of the " horse " may be omitted as two strokes, and the head of the " horse " is also omitted as a " eye " shape. Due to the simple province of Han Li, the foot shape may be less than one stroke, "Historical Records. The 43rd Biography of Uncle Zhang from Wanshi": "Jian is the order of the physicist, the book tells things, the next, the reading is made, and he said: "Mistaken book! The horse is five with the tail, this is four, less than one, on Condemn death!" Very terrified." The font can be seen in "Mawangdui. Laozi Jiaben" Jane 52.

Oracle is used as the original meaning, referring to horses, and the term "carriage and horse" is in "Collection" 10405. In addition, Oracle also has the word "Doma", which is the official name, referring to Simazhi's official official. "Collection" 5775 is: "Almost (hu) many horses compete for the deer, only (get)." Also used as the name of the country, "Collection" 6664: "I cut the horse."

Bronze writing is also used as the original meaning, referring to horses. The large square tripod tripod: "Public rewards for the large white horse." The term "horse ride" is common in bronze inscriptions, which refers to a chariot equipped with four horses. Cheng.‚Äù Or used as official name, such as "Sima", "Doctor Chengma", etc.

The " horse " in the bamboo slips of the Warring States period is used as the original meaning and refers to horses. "Shangbo Bamboo Book III. "Book of Changes" Jane 22: "Good horses are driven by (chasing), benefiting from hardships", which means that a good horse gallops and chases, which is conducive to galloping hard. The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period also have the word "Sima", which is used as the official name. "The Year of the Series" Jane 77-78: "Sima Zifan and Shen Gong vie for fewer holes."

"Said Wen": "Horse, anger. Wu Ye. Like a horse head and a four-legged tail. All horses belong to the horse. ¢í†, ancient prose. ¢í†, Á±íÊñáÈ©¨ is the same as ¢í†, there is a fashion."
humanum_short_description_en: The inscription " horse " is shaped like a horse, and the original meaning is horse. " Ma " is an important radical of Chinese characters.

Heisig: Let the extra vertical stroke in the mane combine with the first vertical stroke to give an image of the horse's long neck. The only odd thing is the tail feathers at the end, but that should present a good image to remember the character by. The fact that the last stroke of mane and the first of tail feathers coincide should no longer surprise you.
* As a primitive, this kanji will mean a team of horses as distinct from the single horse whose primitive we met earlier.
Chinese: Horse is turkey with the drops at the top removed and tail feathers added.
koohii1: Turkey with the drops at the top removed and tail feathers added (this matches stroke order and there are the tail feathers already, why not have the whole bird). If you take the two drops of Èöπ as wings, then horses are like turkeys, but have no wings and have more prominent tail "feathers". Both are actually supposed to be pictographs, though.
koohii2: The top part is half a comb (see frame 1920) with an extra vertical stroke to account for a sturdier version used to comb a horse mane. As a primitive I used the theme of the Trojan Horse. Not the modern computer viruses, but the large wooden horse which led to the demise of Troy and of the Trojans. Either its size (much greater than a live horse), or the fact that it conceals things into its belly, will set it appart from the horse primitive that came in frame 568 ("noon").

The shape of an oracle bone like " horse" is characterized by the mane on the neck of the horse. The early Bronze clan emblems were very pictographic. Later, the glyphs gradually changed into strokes, but the glyphs still often marked the mane of " horse". In the Warring States period, the torso of the " horse" may be omitted as two strokes, and the head of the " horse" is also omitted as a " eye" shape. Due to the simple province of Han Li, the foot shape may be less than one stroke, "Historical Records. The 43rd Biography of Uncle Zhang from Wanshi": "Jian is the order of the physicist, the book tells things, the next, the reading is made, and he said: "Mistaken book! The horse is five with the tail, this is four, less than one, on Condemn death!" Very terrified." The font can be seen in "Mawangdui. Laozi Jiaben" Jane 52. Oracle is used as the original meaning, referring to horses, and the term "carriage and horse" is in "Collection" 10405. In addition, Oracle also has the word "Doma", which is the official name, referring to Simazhi's official official. "Collection" 5775 is: "Almost (hu) many horses compete for the deer, only (get)." Also used as the name of the country, "Collection" 6664: "I cut the horse." Bronze writing is also used as the original meaning, referring to horses. The large square tripod tripod: "Public rewards for the large white horse." The term "horse ride" is common in bronze inscriptions, which refers to a chariot equipped with four horses. "Shangbo Bamboo Book III. "Book of Changes" Jane 22: "Good horses are driven by (chasing), benefiting from hardships", which means that a good horse gallops and chases, which is conducive to galloping hard. The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period also have the word "Sima", which is used as the official name. "The Year of the Series" Jane 77-78: "Sima Zifan and Shen Gong vie for fewer holes." Traditional characters for "È©¨1".
(1) Mammals. The head has a long face, upright ear shells, a hyena on the neck, long hair on the tail, strong limbs, and hoofs. Gentle sex and good running are one of the important power animals.
(2) Make the face look like a horse face. Describes severe facial expressions.
(3) Cavalry.
(4) Military affairs.
(5) Big.
(6) The ancient character of "code". Bargaining chips.
(7) The ancient character of "code". quantifier. Equivalent to heap.
(8) Dialects. Suppress, suppress.
(9) Dialects. Take aim, watch carefully.
(10) "Ping Shui Yun" Ma Yun is Shangsheng 21, which was used to replace the date in the old days, referring to 21.
(11) Last name.

–ï—Å–ª–∏ —Å–æ–µ–¥–∏–Ω–∏—Ç—å —Å —ç—Ç–∏–º –∫–ª—é—á–æ–º –∏–µ—Ä–æ–≥–ª–∏—Ñ ¬´—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π¬ª –∏–ª–∏ ¬´–∏–∑—É–º–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π¬ª (–≤ —Ñ–æ–Ω–µ—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–∏), –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏–º ¬´–µ–∑–¥–∏—Ç—å –≤–µ—Ä—Ö–æ–º¬ª. –ï–∑–¥–∞ –Ω–∞ –ª–æ—à–∞–¥–∏ ‚Äî –∏–∑—É–º–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –æ—â—É—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –Ω–æ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –¥–ª—è —Ç–µ—Ö, –∫—Ç–æ –µ—â–µ –Ω–∏ —Ä–∞–∑—É –Ω–µ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–∂–∏–≤–∞–ª –µ–≥–æ. –ï—Å–ª–∏ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞ —Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –∏–µ—Ä–æ–≥–ª–∏—Ñ ¬´–º—É–¥—Ä–µ—Ü¬ª, –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∞–µ–º —Å–ª–æ–≤–æ ¬´–Ω–∞–µ–∑–¥–Ω–∏–∫¬ª. –°–æ–µ–¥–∏–Ω–∏–≤ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –∫–ª—é—á —Å –∏–µ—Ä–æ–≥–ª–∏—Ñ–æ–º ¬´–ø–æ—Ç–æ–∫¬ª, –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∞–µ–º —Å–ª–æ–≤–æ ¬´–ø–æ—Å–ª—É—à–Ω—ã–π, –ø–æ–∫–æ—Ä–Ω—ã–π¬ª: –æ–±—ä–µ–∑–∂–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –ª–æ—à–∞–¥—å —Ç–∞–∫ –∂–µ –ø–æ—Å–ª—É—à–Ω–∞, –∫–∞–∫ —Å–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω—ã–π –ø–æ—Ç–æ–∫. –ï—Å–ª–∏ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –∫–ª—é—á —Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–∏ –∏–µ—Ä–æ–≥–ª–∏—Ñ–∞ ¬´–¥–≤–µ—Ä—å¬ª, –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑—É–µ—Ç—Å—è —Å–ª–æ–≤–æ ¬´—Å–ø–µ—à–∫–∞¬ª –∏–ª–∏ ¬´—Å—É–µ—Ç–∞¬ª: –ª–æ—à–∞–¥—å —Å—Ç—Ä–µ–º–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –ø–æ–∫–∏–¥–∞–µ—Ç —Å–≤–æ–µ —Å—Ç–æ–π–ª–æ.
